website_summaries.verdict: With a beautiful and more functional new design, Wacom's Intuos4 tablet demonstrates that a lack of competition doesn't necessarily keep you from innovating.
pros: Beautiful, slim and well-thought-out new design
cons: Schmutz very visible on black pen grip
buttons could use a bit more tactile differentiation
need more real-time feedback when configuring

customer_reviews.title: I love mine.
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time. Bought mine used, with a light scratch on the drawing surface. I got a protective film to put over the surface, and it works like new. I did find the soft surface at the outer half of the pen that comes with the tablet was breaking down and had become quite sticky in my hand. I wrapped it with shipping tape, and it works very well. The price for this, being used, was just right, and I love my tablet.
customer_reviews.author: zen_reader

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a medium size Intuos 4 I lost in a house fire. I decided to down size, primarily because after having to replace all of my household goods, I needed to control my spending. Anyway, I use the drawing tablet for stand alone drawing as well as use it in conjunction with my 3D art. I was concerned that the small Intuos 4 was not going to be large enough to meet my needs, but I was wrong! Not only does the smaller size better on my desktop but it just works so well. I saved a fair amount of money by going to the small size and yet it meets my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: webhawk50

customer_reviews.title: such an improvement
customer_reviews.text: i went with the intous4 based on the reviews, and i wanted the small because when i draw i am not one to make huge movements so big ones seem a little more awkward. The active area on this is the size of a small notebook which is what i draw on anyways so its perfect for me. I didn't like the scratchiness of the active area but i solved that by cutting up my nexus 7 screen protector and slapped it on and now its super smooth and i would definitely recommend this to anyone making an upgrade from bamboo or any other older model like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Use this with Photo Shop and astronomical image processing
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome....much easier than using a mouse. I did research the different sizes these come in....went with the middle version after trying my friends largest size which was not comfortable to use for me....he came to the same comclusion and is having buyers remorse. I love the stylus of course....but the mouse is also great...best mouse I have ever used. Be careful with the stylus though....a couple of times the little rocker button on the pen popped out when it snagged on something. I just popped it back in but I worry that it might get lost and then you would have to buy another expensive stylus.
customer_reviews.author: AstroBob

customer_reviews.title: this tablet was great as a refurbished model
customer_reviews.text: First off, this tablet was great as a refurbished model. The first few months is was a dream to work with, however after that the drives kept messing up everything I went to draw the sensitivity was gone. So that started the constant re-installing, shutting down and restarting till I could use it. Some days it'll be fine, other days it wouldn't. All and all I think it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kehara

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless idea but poor execution.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the Wacoms. This is my second one. But the wireless is less than I had hoped for. After finally getting the wireless set up (which was a pain), it lags. It always works better when it's plugged in. I mean, I love it because it's a Wacom, but the wireless is what I bought it for (my chair is always getting snagged in cords) and it just doesn't work as well. Go ahead and get the Intuos5. It's better to have wires and a newer model. Oh, but the dial on the side is great. I love these new shortcut hotkeys much better.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix Briar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality digital tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality tablet. I use this mostly for graphical arts and working with Photoshop. The control of the pen is excellent and the medium sized surface was perfect for my budget and needs. I've used this on a Windows 7 PC with Photoshop and Illustrator. I've never had issues with the tablet - it works seamlessly with the software applications I use. Great product and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: An upgrade for me
customer_reviews.text: Well....of course my review will be very favorable because I upgraded from an Intuos2 to this Intuos4. And I am also upgrading in size from a medium to a large. I tell you, its like night and day. I first want to mention the texture of the surface on the Intuos4. Its like writing on textured paper a bit. Slightly rough that gives the feel of drawing which is something I was really looking forward to witnessing. I compared surfaces and the Intuos2 was like drawing on glass. Way too smooth. Okay for its time I guess but people just did not have anything to compare it to. Now they do. If you can afford a large, invest in it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: For any sketchers out there.
customer_reviews.text: After nearly my whole life of sketching on paper with pencil I decided it was time to digitize and this is what I picked. This tablet is the first I have owned and it feels great. I haven't swapped out tips or anything like that because honestly the tip that came in the pen just works. This is the large model and it really feels like moving around a sketch pad having the larger size. I highly recommend this tablet for anyone who has sketched and wants to go digital. I must also say the setup was easy and smooth. Plugged it in, downloaded Wacom's driver, rebooted and away I went. Easy 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Souldrummer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! 4 years later and still works great!
customer_reviews.text: Almost 4 years later and this tablet still works and looks like new. I use it mostly for Photoshop and 3D graphics; not the newest anymore but it meets all my needs and much better quality than any other graphics tablet Ive tried.
customer_reviews.author: Celexi

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and very poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor customer service. Refuses to troubleshoot my problem every time I have called. This tablet is junk. The calibration is off and there's no way to fix it. I was going to upgrade to a better model, but I'm switching brands instead. I refuse to spend hundreds or thousands of dollars for a company who thinks you are irrelevant the second you but their product.
customer_reviews.author: Birdman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i'm so happy i went with the large digitizer.. ***update*** i recently upgraded my display to an ASUS 27" WQHD display, and im reminded of how happy i am that i have as much digitizer real estate as the large intuos provides.. when zooming in to the pixel level, the additional space grants the freedom to make larger movements with the stylus, which enables smoother transitions, and helps to keep the processing less obvious.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Wu

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Latest Wacom
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is not the latest and greatest from Wacom, introduced around 2010 it is now dated and hard to find these days. Thing is, if you talk to or read reviews from owners of the newest Wacom tablets, quite a few tell you they preferred this model. After reading the specs and and reading the reviews of both tablets, it was a no-brainer to pick this bad boy up for over $100 cheaper than the latest Wacom plus the wireless parts were included which saved another $50. Best part is it has more features and the accessories are significantly cheaper. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intuos 4 Medium Wireless Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this product with Corel Painter 12 and Adobe Photoshop. The pen and tablet are well made and perform wonderfully. Very pleased. The Wacom USB cabled driver is a piece of cake on the other hand. That actually installs first. With Windows 7 64-bit, the Wacom wireless blue tooth driver is a little problematic - perhaps because I also have a blue tooth MS mouse. Windows fights to use/install its own blue tooth pointing device driver and doesn't give up easily. I deleted my mouse driver and forged ahead with the Wacom driver and later rebooted and re-installed my mouse.
customer_reviews.author: The Masked Marauder

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Intuos4 Large Pen Tablet
customer_reviews.text: The Intuos4 Pen Tablet came with a defective USB Cable. I almost sent the tablet back for a refund. I was able to find a digital camera cable, (Which I had), which is used to download photos and I was able to use it to connect the tablet to the computer. I still need a cable for the tablet; I do not intend to leave the camera cable hooked up all the time. The software which was offered with the Intuos4 Tablet has to be downloaded, and the Corel Sketchpad WOULD NOT DOWNLOAD! I am not really happy right now. Hopefully everything will get straightened out.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie

customer_reviews.title: rough surface
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read about the rough surface on the intuos4 before I purchased it!!! I really hate the rough surface and don't know how I will get used to it. I would have ordered another intuos3 had I been able to test the surface first! I have been using wacom tablets since the mid 90s and they have been an invaluable tool. But this is the first one that has ever had a rough surface. My old wacom tablet has glitches in it but I will keep it around in case I get completely fed up with this new one. I wish we at least had the option of buying a smooth surface to replace this rough one.
customer_reviews.author: Adelle T

customer_reviews.title: Great for the artistic brush strokes.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, works together with Photoshop to process photos. Much better control than mouse alone. This is my second Wacom. First one was small and I liked it pretty much, but this bigger one is much nicer, and will even morph the brush depending on the angle and pressure of the stylus.
customer_reviews.author: Tam Alesam

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Its been a great tablet. had it for years now. sadly the place where i insert the power cord into the tablet isn't working now (almost 4 years later) but it has an easy fix. apparently its a common problem once its gather age. the large is nice but i think i could've managed great with medium. the large exceed what room i need. the stylus marks are obvious ni the center while the edges are hardly used.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Ziebeil

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but USB ports are not durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a common issue for Wacom tablets, but the mini USB ports are not durable. If you get the Intuos 4 wired tablet, you’re basically screwed after a couple years because the connection to the ports is so poor and there isn’t Bluetooth capability. Get a version that can go wireless as a failsafe or you risk shelling out another couple hundred dollars, learned my lesson!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intuos4 Wireless Pen Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Well, This is "The Real Deal" for all you Photogs dealing with post digital photography work-ups. Once you get a hang of this technology you will not return to the old way of doing things. Next to all my photography gear, Mac computer, CS5 program, cameras and lenses, this is the tool set that brings it all together with the greatest results for all your hard work in photography. If there is a hidden artist within the realm of all that you do and see, this tool will help to bring out the very best in what you DO and SEE... Have a great photog day! V/R PhotogDog
customer_reviews.author: PhotogDogTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need, nothing you don't.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned and worked with many Wacom products over the years, including the intuos 3, intuos 2, graphire, bamboo, as well as a few off-market brands, and I can say; Wacom knocked this one out of the park. The buttons are intuitive, and easy to use; the labeling is simple, but easily customized for non-standard applications, and the touch ring is a stroke of genius. It feels sharp and intuitive to work with; even more so than the Intuos 3, and the surface has just the right amount of drag to feel natural; unlike the slippery, slidey feeling of cheaper tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Kasaron

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for creative peeps!
customer_reviews.text: Listen...if you draw, if you paint, if you doodle and sketch...You'll love this thing. Quite honestly, I've always been skeptical of tablets, even doubtful...But after only a few minutes of use with this Wacom, I truly felt stupid for not buying one years ago!...Don't sweat the learning curve, it exists...but it's not dramatic...Just do your thing!...This tablet integrates beautifully with Photoshop and Illustrator (among other apps) and the functions are totally configurable...Go for it, you will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: tp23

customer_reviews.title: I had to return the one I purchased on Amazon but bought another that was perfect
customer_reviews.text: Although my purchase experience from Amazon was bad I loved it And bought another one here at home. I really like the way the side lights up and is easily programmable. Don't get me wrong it takes a little bit of work to do it but it's worthwhile to program for each of your applications. With the new pan that I got fixed just the right sensitivity to do everything from editing photographs in Photoshop to doing straight up illustrations. I would highly recommend this for anybody who serious about digital drawing.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine P.

customer_reviews.title: My most favorite tablet yet
customer_reviews.text: I've upgraded a couple of times over the years from a Graphire 3 to the Bamboo Pen & Touch, but the Intous4 is by far my favorite. It's bluetooth connection is solid and the OLED displays are pretty cool too. The only complaints I have are the same a everyone else; until you use it a bit and wear down the surface, it's quite hard on stylus nibs. Also, mine didn't come with a bluetooth dongle, although the wireless kit for the Intous4 includes one from Wacom...
customer_reviews.author: Redd

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a wacom tablet since the early 2000's so it's been a while. And WOW have they come a long way! I love the Wacom Intuos 4! It was very easily installed and up and running in a few minutes and by the second day I no longer needed to use my mouse at all. I'm a graphic designer / UX specialist so I work on a lot of graphics but I also do a lot of research, reviewing and documentation so I was unsure of how much use I would get out of it. I would highly recommend this to anyone interested in switching over to a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: LoveCincy

customer_reviews.title: Rocky Start - Happy Ending...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a refurbished tablet a month ago -- the pen worked, but the mouse was DOA. The return process was a living nightmare. I got Amazon's A-Z protection involved, and I got my refund, then I bought this one -- WORKS GREAT. I have been using it with Paint Shop Pro, and z-brush. I have to admit, it is a little different than modeling with the mouse. Some people claim that they never use tha mouse, but I find the brush to sensitive to use for normal navigation stuff. Still haven't figured out how to use the angle functions, but I'm sure it will all reveal itself in time. BTW- The medium is aa great size for me.
customer_reviews.author: anchornm

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my son and it's very cool to work with and really makes the drawing experience rewarding. I coupled this with AutoDesk Sketchbook Pro 2011 software and they make a great team. I was worried that the pad would be to small but that has not been an issue at all, no need to get a huge tablet unless you are a true professional. All in all a great tablet that has really made him happy and he picked up using it very fast so not over complicated. We like it
customer_reviews.author: nickmarine

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as everyone said.
customer_reviews.text: There were things I was prepared for, like the actual drawing pad being the size of an index card. But it was okay, since I have small hands and rarely need to make large sweeping strokes. And then there was stuff I wasn't prepared for, like the pen malfunctioning. But I just fiddled with the nibs for a while, then left it on its side, and the issue went away. Customer service was helpful too. Overall I'm very happy with my tablet. Its defiantly better than the cheeper tablet I was using before that was giving me no end of problems. It was worth the extra expense.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: as Expected...
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a graphire 4 "s" this is a great upgrade for me, sensitivity is nicer than my old wacom, i like the feel of a more natural drawing and certenly the active aera is better when working with 2 monitors, 15 and 17 inches, maybe bigger active area would work great. I do digital painting as a hobbie, nibs can run down fast! A bit overpriced IMO, it feels cheap once you unpacked, without loosing the nice thin look. Overall is very nice the only thing i miss about my old graphire is the plastic cover of the tablet..
customer_reviews.author: Raul Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product. Opened up my design possibilities infinitely.
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play. Incredible features. Wish I didn't waste so many years without it. It has made a huge difference in Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop. Also purchased Corel Painter 11 upgrade. Incredible possibilities. There are plenty of reviews giving details about features and limitations, but that's not my purpose for giving a review. Everyone's work experience is variable, so I'm just writing to relay this product did not disappoint. It has immediately become a staple that I will never again be without.
customer_reviews.author: J M

customer_reviews.title: Other than that I would highly recommend if you are looking for an older and cheaper ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for I think 4 years now and its still works perfectly. The only down fall is one of the cord inserts broke but thank god they have 2. Other than that I would highly recommend if you are looking for an older and cheaper money wise tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Ritter

customer_reviews.title: love it still 5 stars after more than 2 years ...
customer_reviews.text: love it still 5 stars after more than 2 years of use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As good as it's advertized
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional artist, I am just an amateur artist with too much free time. so the tablet is very easy to use once I got it all I had to do was plug it in to the computer and installed the software downloaded sketchbook express and I was set. I did a couple of sketches was very pleased with how clean and easy they came out. if you want to see what an amateur can do with this you can look me up on [...] under tekatomon. I am going to have to buy the full version of Sketchbook 2010 though.
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: great product.
customer_reviews.text: intuos 4 is great. such an improvement from intuos 3. it definitely feels like i have more control when drawing and the line quality is so much better. I also love the different nibs that simulate different media. the "pencil" nib is my favorite so far. I was surprised at how quickly the intous arrived. I ordered it on Friday and it was on my doorstep Monday. Only negative review is that the software installation cd didn't work. However I was able to download the proper drivers from the intous website. would definitely recommend this product. I also found the 4 x 6 to be a perfect size- not at all too small.
customer_reviews.author: jjj

customer_reviews.title: I love Wacom tablets
customer_reviews.text: I love Wacom tablets, but it's nice to see a good deal on a very gently used tablet that was clearly cared for by the original owner. It is going to last me a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M Poole

customer_reviews.title: Super table
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. I still use it after over 2 years, and it is like new. the pen tips do not scratch the board. The extra tips that come with it make for a very long use before having to buy a new set of tips. The only thing i didn't like as much was the mouse, which doesn't have the best grip, and is of course limited to the induction part of the tablet. The mouse is in now way a deterrent to buy this awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: D. Auffret

customer_reviews.title: Replacing an older tablet
customer_reviews.text: My old computer, running Windows XP recently died. I have been using a Wacom 12 X 12 tablet for photoshop retouching for many years. My new computer has Windows 7 and no serial ports so I could no longer use the old tablet. I used the Wacom site to compare tablets and to find the best price which was through Amazon. Ordering was easy, and delivery was quick. The new tablet is great to use, and has many features lacking on my old tablet from the mid 90s. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Naumann

customer_reviews.title: Finally free of the wires
customer_reviews.text: This is the third tablet I have owned. The previous one was the largest size, but with a wired connection, that was forever getting in the way. I am much happier with the medium/wireless version. Looking forward to buying a new laptop and this size will travel well with the laptop, where the larger version would not. My only negative feeling is that there is no warning that battery is low, and you MUST connect immediately. Or... I haven't figured out that there is a warning yet. Overall, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Encaustic Artist

customer_reviews.title: Stick to cable
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth hangs quite a lot I end up using the USB cable, which kind of defies the purpose. I contacted customer support, they gave me a very lame excuse that Bluetooth technology is not perfect, and they have my case documented several times. I never had any other issues with my other Bluetooth devices. As a pen Tablet, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Beco G.

customer_reviews.title: Glad i bought it....
customer_reviews.text: I actually also have the medium Intuos4 pen tablet and decided to buy the smaller version for travel. I love to travel and usually would have to wait for my projects to be done before I do that or had to carry super heavy computer bag through security checks. But now with the smaller tablet hooked to ultra-light laptop I can pretty much work from anywhere and the security checks are a breeze. I was concerned about its size but it works the same way as the medium size tablet and a definite great investment for me. Truly Mobil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my 24yo son who is non-art related grad student and amateur artist/illustrator. He made immediate out-of-the box impressive illustrations and productive use of the software bundle. I've had a little experience with the small wacom tablets so I didn't expect to be disappointed. As a hobbyist purchase goes, it wasn't inexpensive, but no more than the many 'game system' purchases we've made over the years. All in all, I'm satisfied with the purchase and wishing I could justify one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I looked into getting the new Intuous 5 and after reading the reviews, decided the 4 would be a better fit for me. This was on sale for an excellent price. It is big, but I figured out a way to make it work with my desk configuration. It arrived promptly and works well for me. I use it in Photoshop, Illustrator and a bit in Painter. I'm not one who has fully converted to the tablet from a mouse. I just use it when I need to draw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Portable on the go Photo retoucher
customer_reviews.text: I already own the 21UX wacom tablet.. but since the tablet is too large and heavy for constant travel and most of the time Iam on the road editing images.. so i purchased the small wacom intous 4. All I have to say is wacom never seize to amaze me with their products. this small tablet can be adjusted left or right handed and as for the pen can change the feel tips for those who prefer pen to paper feel.. Only wish the tablet could be wireless but overall great product.. its a must buy for those who are serious graphic and photo retouchers..
customer_reviews.author: Luis D. Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tablet. Small, but compact and just as effective as the larger ones. I did have some trouble on occasion getting the pad to sense the pen, but that could have been a computer issue.
customer_reviews.author: Verge1

customer_reviews.title: Takes some practice
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Photoshop and have been using it for years. I wonder if anyone else had this issue, but I am finding it a bit difficult to relearn to use this pen vs. the mouse. I think I am a pro when it comes to use of the mouse with Photoshop, so when I use this pen, my lines just don't come up accurate and straight. This device is I am sure a great help, but I guess I am still in the process of mastering.
customer_reviews.author: Valeria

customer_reviews.title: I use CAD drawing tools, and this just wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I use CAD drawing tools, and this just wasn't for me. This seems more artistic and less technical for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: jmumv

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet -- See Customer Discussions for Nib Wear Fix
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the tablet for five weeks now, and really like it. My only quibble is that I'd make the stylus slightly thinner, but that's a personal preference. Regarding the issues with nib wear, I modified mine right out of the box by buffing the surface with steel wool to get a surface that still had some roughness (like smooth paper), but doesn't appear to wear down the nib at all. See the customer discussions for more details.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hollasch

customer_reviews.title: A classic...
customer_reviews.text: The Intuos4 is a classic, and there's very little wrong with it that others haven't commented on already. I chose to go with the 4 because the features offered in the 5 weren't that important to me. Best bought with a padded carrying case, because it doesn't come with anything but a small disposable wrapper for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Guyette

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as Intuos5, maybe better
customer_reviews.text: Works just as good as the 5. Same pressure ratings, same drivers. Don’t waste your money on getting the five when this has all the same features except the useless touch. It also has a light up shortcut display menu that is super helpful!
customer_reviews.author: john sloan

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend bought this for me while I was in college and 3 years later it is still working!! I suggest buying one of those films because the stylus does scratch the surface! I am considering purchasing the Cintiq 22in but Im going to wait for now. BTW it was a refurbished one as well! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Shields

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome device. I am able to enhance photos so ...
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome device. I am able to enhance photos so much more precisely. I will never be without a Pen Tablet.
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoKRW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little tablet
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version of the Wacom tablet I got this one because I was happy with my tablet but wanted something more portable. This tablet works very well it got to me quickly was packed well and it is not any bigger than my Mac Book. I would recommend this tablet to anyone that wants the power of a Wacom tablet and the portability that this tablet gives.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Morse

customer_reviews.title: The wireless is a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: My old Intuos3's cord was just fraying into a fire hazard, electrical tape was no longer doing the trip. I'm very hard on tablet cords. This Intuos4 wireless is doing the trick, perfectly. Other reviewers are right, that the nibs seem to wear down a little faster than the old ones - but for me it's worth it, I really love the new function buttons and control wheel, and the LED display to tell you what they're mapped to. And the sensitivity of the stylus is fantastic. I haven't experienced any significant problem with lag. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Resch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade from the Intuos3
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Intuos3 tablets at my school for awhile now and have loved the ease of use and precise movement of the cursor. I was debating over buying a used Intuos3 or getting a new Intuos4 and I'm so happy I went with this tablet. Not only does it do everything the Intuos3 did, but it has a greater degree of customization, smoother movement, and a wider range of touch sensitivity. If you're looking for a tablet for artistic work, I've yet to use a better line than the Intuos and this version is nearly perfect.
customer_reviews.author: NeimanJ

customer_reviews.title: Form an average user
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mainly to combat the aches I was having in my wrists. The tablet works great and since using it haven't had much of an issue with my wrist, du to holding a pen being much more comfortable. I also use this with Zbrush and have found it much more intuitive than using a mouse. Haven't had any issues with sensitivity and the bundled software is a welcomed bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment!
customer_reviews.text: So I had been putting off buying a wacom tablet for just over a year now. I ended up buying the small tablet, that was also refurbished. I love this tablet so much I bought a nice case for it as well so I don't worry about scratching it since I take it EVERYWHERE with me!!!! wish i would have bought it sooner! But this size is perfect for me, fits perfectly in my laptop bag!
customer_reviews.author: ChasingMegan

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that makes this product 4 stars is that if you get even the smallest particle in the scroll wheel, you have to use compressed air to get it out, otherwise you'll have to push the button more than once to get it to do what you want. Otherwise, this product is amazing! I can't really compare it to anything else because this is my first tablet, but I knew there was a learning curve to them and it made it the process as simple and enjoyable as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Etchie

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Intuos 4
customer_reviews.text: I gave this tablet to my son. I'm a photographer by trade, and have been using Wacom tablets for many years. I was going to keep this one and give my kid the old one, but there's nothing wrong with my Intuos3 medium tablet, and I really preferred the layout of the express keys and touch strips, so i kept it. Nothing wrong with the 4, it would just have taken time to grow accustomed to the new layout, and there was no motivation for me to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Best pen tablet for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The Intuos4 still holds the title for best pen tablet for the money. Extreme precision and easy to use. The wireless bluetooth works perfectly. Even though this is an older model, Wacom still sent me an updated key code to download and install their free drawing and Adobe photo enhancment software. What an awesome deal!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's worth buying a Wacom
customer_reviews.text: I was swayed by the dark side to look at other brands of pen tablets as well. After reading countless reviews, I decided to follow everyone's advice, which is "Save up to get a Wacom instead". I use my Intuos 4 Medium for most of my applications, and it is indispensable for Photoshop. I love it, love it, love it. My only complaint, and a minor one at that, is that for a little while the driver would uninstall when I would reboot my computer, and I would have to reinstall the driver again. After some prompt friendly support from Wacom, I was able to figure it out. Highly recommend this product for anyone doing graphic work on the website
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am a freelance 3d animator that has been using a wacom intuos 3 for a few years now. The tablet does everything its advertised to do, my favorite feature is the plethora of programmable buttons, I no longer have to use keyboard shortcuts and is exactly why I bought it. The only problem I have with this, is the Bluetooth connectivity is a little finicky sometimes. Although, this could be the usb Bluetooth device I just purchased, but it occasionally will just loose connection. Overall, great product.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: everything else was fine!
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well, but I only have two issues using it: 1. There are a few deep scratches on the active area and the back, but so far, I don't think that impacts the work you can produce, but aesthetically, it makes the tablet seem a bit off. And 2. The pen nib ring seems to be missing. It might have fallen out or gotten lost somewhere, but I know that's important to remove nibs that tend to wear out with any of the other ones available without using tweezers. Otherwise, everything else was fine!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stout

customer_reviews.title: The best tablet I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. The feel of the pen is so smooth and the pen control is great. It is much better than the Intuos3 in my opinion. I always prefer a medium size tablet..that's what I use at work (graphic and textile design)...but I bought a small for home because it was so much cheaper. I like the medium better, but am still very happy with the small.
customer_reviews.author: KALV

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Initial tablet wouldn't turn on, had another sent. It has much more sensitivity than that Bamboo Fun I had previously. It works well with Paint Tool Sai and Photoshop CS3. The overall product dimensions are huge, make sure you have the desk space. I am willing to give up the space for a much larger drawing area and the highest pressure sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Chess

customer_reviews.title: perfect for photoshop
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional photographer and I use photoshop a lot. This makes editing swifter and easier and a must have for retouching. Customizing the controls give you more control and quicker solutions to command shortcuts. Great size too, the screen itself is maybe 4x6 which is all you really need to get a good brush stroke, great product
customer_reviews.author: Mth44

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: The tablet arrived exactly as advertised! I was so nervous because it seemed almost too good to be true, but aside from a little wear the device functioned perfectly and set up was a breeze. For a used tablet it was in excellent condition. 10/10 would buy from again.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: A very useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: Love my little tablet. I'm using it right now, and every day.
customer_reviews.author: Bamajean

customer_reviews.title: intuous4large tablet=awesome
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing this tablet in 2009 the quality and quantity of my artwork has improved to some insanely unpredicted level. The feel of the pen on the pad is something almost unbelievable...I actually almost sharpened the tip of the pen one night. I have used Sketchbook pro for drawing with great success, and have never had any issues or problems with this tablet for three years. I change the nibs as needed (cheap), and dust the drawing surface. worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for the on the go designer or student
customer_reviews.text: I had the Large Intuos4 but found that carrying it to and from school was troublesome, as I do walk to school. I bought this one and it's great. Every botton on the tablet, pen, and mouse is programable with makes it very personal. The drawing space may seem small but it actually matches perfectly with any screen, the only draw back is the small work area makes the mouse almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: but the drawing area showed more wear than one or two uses and the pen felt loose like it had been taken apart and put back toge
customer_reviews.text: Tablet was sold as "Very Good" and as only been used a couple of times, but the drawing area showed more wear than one or two uses and the pen felt loose like it had been taken apart and put back together. That said, it works well and I haven't had any problems with it, so overall fine, though it should have been advertised more accurately.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lippert

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Intuos 4
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the Intuos 4. I purchased this model instead of the Intuos 5 due to some mediocre reviews and I really didn't care if I could use my fingers to point/draw. This tablet was also much cheaper, as it was discontinued. I wish that Wacom would simply have a download center on their website that instructed people on how to fix all the Windows 7 problems that occur with any Wacom tablet. There are several things that cause performance issues, but they can all be turned off, IF you know where to go on the web.
customer_reviews.author: Photog

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My Intuos3 broke down recently, so I bought a small Intuos4 tablet. This works great! I like how the USB cord can be taken off from the side unlike Intuos3. The surface is pretty rough and I didn't want to wear down my nibs so quickly, so I bought a couple of Intuos3 surface sheets and applied it straight on top of the Intuos4 sheet. The Intuos3 sheet's width is slightly shorter than the Intuos4 sheet, but I haven't had problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rasenth

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've ever made!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an art major with a focus in graphic design, and without a doubt, this has to be the most important purchase I've ever made. The tablet works beautifully, and I love that I'm able to program the buttons on the side and on the pen to do different things to suit my own style. I'm in love with this tablet. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Dream It, Do It

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time I use my mouse but there are a few times when I really need to be more precise when using my graphic programs and this pen allows me to do that a little better than with a mouse. I find that the tip is very sensitive and I have to hold my hand steady when I'm trying to get good precision.
customer_reviews.author: KayakingKim

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time for editing photos. Going from using a mouse to using the Wacom Tablet was a great move.
customer_reviews.author: Tacman

customer_reviews.title: A stroke of genius.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Wacom product and first tablet for that matter but from what I have experienced it's very responsive, build quality is great and the OLED is cool to look at. The writing surface feels just like writing on paper with a pencil. Other than that I'm still learning the tablet... will post more when I have some more to write.
customer_reviews.author: lostintheamazon

customer_reviews.title: It's a good choice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased for my daughter who is very passionate about her artwork. She says it's very easy to use. The pen strokes are very natural, like you're drawing on paper.The small is very adequate. It came with an abundance of pen nibs and very nice case to hold the nibs. It was also easy to install the product, no CD required.
customer_reviews.author: dadu

customer_reviews.title: Having problems
customer_reviews.text: When the tablet works, it works really good. The problem is that a lot of the time it doesn't work. The light that says it is on, comes on but some of the other lights will not come on. It won't respond to the mouse or tablet pen. I have had to reinstall two times and it still is not working right. Don't know if other people have this trouble or not. If it would work all the time I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: rteach

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: Likely one of the best things I have ever purchased from this or any site. It works incredibly well and has crazy sensitivity along with a whole host of features I couldn't begin to understand. Would recommend to any and all digital artists for both photo manipulation and free-form rasterizing.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie

customer_reviews.title: Beginning artist daughter likes it
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift for my daughter who seems consumed with Japanese Anime and is attempting to duplicate everything she can. It did not come with an acceptable software suite / drawing package. so that you will have to supply yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Hohlt

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for design/digital art
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have a tablet before, so my ability to create design/digital art has been very much expanded by getting this new tool! I bought the Intuos4 Medium refurbished, and am happy with it. Things that work well for me -- the 'wheel,' the short-cut keys on the left, the using a stylus bit. Minor issue -- sometimes the brush size is off; maybe Photoshop and the tablet have trouble communicating so while the circle indicating how large the brush or eraser is is huge, the actual stroke is much smaller. Not a huge issue, in that it usually gets reset again or I just hit undo, but definitely a minor inconvenience!
customer_reviews.author: Ping

customer_reviews.title: greatness
customer_reviews.text: i was a lil worried when i bought this cuz everyone said the nibs would wear out in no time. so far i see no signs of wear on the one i been using. this is the first tablet i ever owned so i am getting used to it all. i prolly have a light touch so that might be why i am not wearing out the nibs yet. but so far i have to see that product has been great
customer_reviews.author: Drunkie

customer_reviews.title: More than enough
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the small and it's enough to take on any task. I thought it would be a hassle not knowing what the buttons were assigned to since it didn't have the little labels like the Medium or + sizes but it's no problem at all. This tablet is the first one I have ever used, so I don't know what to compare to, but this tablet is amazing. Wish the cable to connect to computer was shorter since I don't think anyone would be working on stuff so far away from their computer. Overall awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Youngmahn Moon

customer_reviews.title: This was an excellent purchase! There was one small scratch just on ...
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend uses this everyday! This was an excellent purchase! There was one small scratch just on the surface of the drawing area, but this does not effect her drawing ability at all and you can purchase seperatly extra drawing area stickers! Great purchase and wonderful price!
customer_reviews.author: Latte

customer_reviews.title: I love my tablet.
customer_reviews.text: It takes work to learn to draw on a tablet, even to trace, but it's worth the trouble. Before computers I could never "ink" a drawing worth spit, but thanks to the Intuos, I can now "'ink" my art like a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Rustad

customer_reviews.title: Really useful tool for any graphic designer.
customer_reviews.text: I personally still have a use for a mouse, and was not quite ready to switch over to a full touch wacom tablet. The intuos 4 is an excellent product, and does everything I need. I've been a bit weary about the nibs wearing down, as others may have mentioned, but I have a light touch that hasn't caused any issues so far. I found this is a really practical product that goes a long way for any graphic designer looking to enhance their work!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Item Came Dirty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product new, how ever it came dirty and the stylist is sticky as if it has been used and thrown in dirt! Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great size and nice features
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for digital illustration. Works very well out of the box. Takes some adjustment if using dual monitors because it fits both monitors onto the tablet ratio. Does not come with Blue tooth dongle . . which is kind of a shame. Also extended use or heavy rendering will cause a little bit of lag at times. After I got mine a friend of a friend got the large tablet . . . it is pretty massive. If portability is important . . . the Wireless is a great size. It fits well in laptop bags and is a similar dimension to Mac Book Pro 15 but a bit thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Cunha

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Thought the size would bother me. NOPE. Anyone that has not used a tablet of this caliber before should know Wacom Intuos delivers. Quality is fantastic, of course at the price it is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Intuos 4
customer_reviews.text: Came as expected. Hardly used. Working great. Use this same tablet at work.
customer_reviews.author: I. Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet but maybe too large
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tablet. Only comment is that unless you know you need the larger area the medium will work fine. No harm in the getting the larger sizes (except your wallet) but I have simply set it to use a smaller area in the middle of the tablet so the larger area is a waste for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: GMoneyPhx

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Intous4
customer_reviews.text: New features such as the Touch Ring & Radial Menu make navigation easy. Nice design as well. My only complaint is they made the surface more rough which wears down my pen nibs way too fast. If I could have the touch ring & radial menu with the Intous3 surface I would be truly happy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kavanagh

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this with photoshop CS5 and it is an excellent value. I had a small problem with setup (due to my unfamiliarity with my new iMac) and their tech support emailed me and set an appt time that they would call. They were prompt and solved my problem within a few minutes. I am new to the graphic environment and the small table has been working beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: wdr

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works Great! I heard the Intuos5 was not much different, just with a some more productive touch features so I decide to get this since its less expensive. I haven't really got the chance to tried it out, but it all seems to work great and it meets my basic needs for Photoshop and Illustrator. This is first time with a Wacom product. Sorry if I couldn't be more helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Wacom tablets for many years now and would never go back to using a mouse. I am a professional graphic artist and the precision of the pen vs the mouse makes my job much easier. Very good products.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent instrument
customer_reviews.text: Gave my husband hours of happy productive time while suffering from cancer. Better than watching TV all day, waiting to die.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: My drawings have improved 100%
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a wacom tablet for about 20 years. The first one I got was huge! Probably 2 feet by 2 feet! I've had several since then. Not because they wear out but I kept getting smaller and smaller. The last one I had was maybe 4 inches by 4 inches. But this new one is amazing. My drawings have improved. I have more control. I love it. The price was right for me and it is beautiful sitting next to my laptop. If you're considering getting one of these don't hesitate- just do it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathaleen S. O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Is easy to install, easy to use, the shortcut bottoms are "customizable", the size is really good, it work with all software without problem, wacom have a really nice costumer service, I love this piece of technology.
customer_reviews.author: Yo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Pro
customer_reviews.text: The Intuos4 small is great.Since it's cheaper and has all the possibility of the other larger versions of the tablet(except the cosmetic features like the led screens).It's about personal preference if you work with large swings or with small.I even found out that I work on mainly even on smaller area on the active surface.So it's all about personal comfort about the size of the tablet.One great thing is that the small intuos4 is really compact for people who travel a lot and use a laptop to do their work while traveling.Overall cheap and great product!
customer_reviews.author: okuma_10

customer_reviews.title: Small by the size, bigger by its versatility!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a small desk and for travel. Love the wireless mouse and the button and wheel functions on the side; it's also great for both right and left handed people. How cool is that?
customer_reviews.author: CJ Athanase

product_meta.title: Wacom Intuos4 Large Pen Tablet
product_meta.description:
Size:Large| Style:WiredWith a new design and features inspired by members of the professional creative community, Intuos4 redefines the pen tablet experience. Featuring Wacom¿s new pen tip sensor technology and 2,048 levels of pen pressure sensitivity, the Intuos4 pen captures the most subtle nuances of pressure, allowing you to dynamically adjust exposure, brush size, opacity and more. User-defined ExpressKeys activate frequently used shortcuts and modifiers, while the accompanying, illuminated ExpressKey displays on the medium, large and extra large models, provide a constant reminder of each key¿s function. The finger-sensitive Touch Ring quickly controls up to 4 different functions such as canvas rotation, zoom, scroll, brush size and more

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The large Intuos4 tablet is perfect for creative professionals who work in large format or who are trained to work from the shoulder or elbow. With 102.5 square inches of working area, this tablet provides a generous workspace. The large has eight ExpressKeys with illuminated displays that provide easy reference for your assigned functions. 



Like all Intuos4 tablets, the Intuos4 large features Wacom's new tip sensor technology to deliver an even finer level of control. You can initiate pen pressure control with only a single gram of pressure and a feather-light touch. With 2048 levels of pressure sensitivity and 60 degrees of tilt recognition, the Intuos4 pen simulates like never before the natural feel and accuracy of working with traditional brushes, pens, and markers.

Professional photographers, designers and artists agree: Intuos4 pen tablets speed production time for photo editing, design and art creation. When working with digital assets, there isn't a more natural tool than a pen for increased comfort and control.

Intuos4 redefines the Intuos pen tablet experience, thanks to a new design and new features inspired by members of our professional creative community.

WHAT'S NEW WITH INTUOS4

Slightest Nuance
Featuring Wacom's new Tip Sensor, Intuos4 now captures the slightest nuance of pen pressure, starting with only a single gram of force. Switches, Where You Want Them
User-defined switches are preset to "right-click" and "double-click" or can be set to your most commonly used functions. Working Under Pressure
With 2048 levels of pressure sensitivity, Intuos4 gives you the creative power to dynamically adjust exposure, brush size, line weight, opacity, and more. Ergonomic Ahhhs
Intuos4 is the most comfortable Intuos tablet yet. The slim-profiled tablet has gently sloping, easy glide palm rests that provide complete support for working on all areas of the tablet. Natural Feel
The Intuos4 Grip Pen features a new contoured barrel designed to minimize grip effort, reduce stress to your hand and wrist, and otherwise emulate the feel of your favorite writing instrument. Peek Inside
The new pen stand not only functions as a convenient pen holder, but also provides a handy twist-off storage compartment containing pen nibs and a pen nib removal tool. Who Says You Can't Take Shortcuts
Set up your ExpressKeys to activate your own unique, time-saving shortcuts and modifiers in each of your applications. See your settings change in the illuminated display areas as you switch between applications. Your Settings at a Glance
On Medium, Large and Extra Large tablets, illuminated displays provide a visual reference to each key's function. On the Small tablet, just press the default ExpressKey to display the settings on screen. A Turn for the Better
The finger-sensitive Touch Ring provides intuitive control of scrolling, zooming, brush size, canvas rotation or layer selection. A central toggle button allows you to control up to four different functions in each application. Software, No Less
Intuos4 owners are entitled to download their choice from a selection of titles by industry leaders such as Adobe®, Autodesk® and Corel®. Reversible
The innovative, ambidextrous design of Intuos4 allows you to maximize the productivity of both your hands. Having the ExpressKeys and Touch Ring on the same side of the tablet ensures that they are perfectly positioned for use with the hand that is not holding the pen. Many Accessories
To complement your Intuos4, choose from a variety of accessories including the Grip Pen, the Classic Pen, 6D Art Pen, Airbrush, Inking Pen, Pro Accessory Kit and more. 


USE YOUR INTUOS4 TABLET'S NEW FEATURES:
 * Quickly and professionally edit photos and create digital artwork with natural pen control
 * New pen tip sensor technology lowers activation force and captures every nuance of pen pressure
 * 2048 levels of pen pressure sensitivity for precise pressure control
 * User-defined ExpressKeys™ & multi-function Touch Ring put time saving shortcuts, modifiers, scrolling, zooming, and more at your fingertips.
 * Illuminated ExpressKey displays provide a constant reference each Key's setting
 * Custom radial menus for rapid navigation
 * New Precision Mode simplifies detail work

WHAT'S IN THE BOX

Intuos4 large pen tablet, Intuos4 Grip Pen, Intuos4 mouse, pen stand, ten replacement nibs (five standard nibs, one flex nib, one stroke nib, and three hard felt nibs), nib extractor, 2.5m USB cable, Quick Start Guide, installation CD (includes tablet driver software and electronic user manual)
